simulator.framework

Class FaultInjector

  • java.lang.Object
    • simulator.payloads.Networkable
      • simulator.framework.FaultInjector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Parser, TimeSensitive

    public class FaultInjector
extends Networkable
implements TimeSensitive, Parser
    Responsible for creating and injecting fault objects as defined by the fault file (-ff).

    • Method Detail

      • parse

        public void parse(java.lang.String[] words,
         FileTokenizer sourceFT)
           throws java.text.ParseException
        Description copied from interface: Parser
        Callback method used by FileTokenizer to notify the parser that a new line has been found. sourceFT is primarily passed so that the lineMessage() method can be used to create accurate messages. Because FileTokenizer processes #INCLUDE directives, the sourceFT may differ from the original FileTokenizer used to initiate parsing.
        Specified by:
        parse in interface Parser
        Parameters:
        words - The current line from the file being parsed with comments removed and split into tokens by whitespace.
        sourceFT - The FileTokenizer that created the line.
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - Thrown if the syntax of the line is not valid in the context of the parser.

      • getStats

        public java.lang.String getStats()

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

      • timerExpired

        public void timerExpired(java.lang.Object callbackData)
        Description copied from interface: TimeSensitive
        Called when a Timer expires.
        Specified by:
        timerExpired in interface TimeSensitive
        Parameters:
        callbackData - the value that was passed to Timer#start(long,Object), or null if Timer#start(long) was called instead.
